question_sentence: Soaring demand for Dubai chocolate has triggered a global supply crunch of which nut?
evidence: The craze for the pistachio-filled chocolate bars has exacerbated a shortage of the nut and sent prices soaring from $7.65 a pound a year ago to about $10.30 now. For more on the impact of our bougie food trends, listen to this week's episode of The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: What's the name of the new colour discovered by scientists?
evidence: Scientists have discovered a new colour no human has seen before, according to findings published in the journal Science Advances. Olo is a vivid blue-green that only appears after laser pulses are fired into the eyes to stimulate specific cells in the retina.

question_sentence: Bite marks on a Roman-era skeleton have been cited as evidence that gladiators fought which animal?
evidence: Gladiator battles against lions are depicted on pottery and mosaics, but the teeth imprints on the pelvis of the skeleton, originally found in York, are the first physical evidence of such bouts in Roman Britain and beyond. Academics compared the lesions with modern teeth marks to identify the big cat.

question_sentence: Donald Trump's Department of Homeland Security chief had what item stolen while out at dinner?
evidence: Kristi Noem's handbag was stolen while she was dining with her family at a burger restaurant in Washington. Inside the bag were Noem's driving licence, passport, DHS access badge, house keys, medication, blank cheques and about $3,000 in cash.

question_sentence: What is the name of the non-hormonal male contraceptive that has been declared a success in its first clinical trial?
evidence: The water-soluble gel is implanted in the sperm ducts and stops sperm from mixing with semen. Designed to break down in the body after a set amount of time, manufacturer Contraline said Adam could offer a reversible alternative to vasectomies. The results of the clinical trial have not yet been published in a peer-reviewed journal, and don't include data on reversibility.

question_sentence: What was the name of the robot that finished first in the Humanoid Robot Half-Marathon in Beijing?
evidence: Humans and robots competed in the first Humanoid Robot Half-Marathon in Beijing, with robots permitted to stop for battery swaps. Tien Kung Ultra took first place among the robots, finishing in 2 hours and 40 minutes. The fastest human completed the race in 1 hour and 2 minutes.

question_sentence: A letter has resurfaced this week appearing to shed light on the marriage of which literary titan?
evidence: It has long been believed that Shakespeare left his wife, Anne, in Stratford-upon-Avon during his time in London, but a letter fragment addressed to "Good Mrs Shakspaire" at a London address appears to cast doubt on the assumption that theirs was a distant or unhappy marriage. The letter, from an unknown sender, asks Mrs Shakespeare to pay out a sum of money held in trust by her husband.

question_sentence: How much is the proposed "baby bonus" the White House is considering to encourage Americans to have more children?
evidence: The White House is exploring ways to encourage Americans to have children amid declining birth rates. One proposal includes a $5,000 "baby bonus" for new parents, while another suggests awarding a "National Medal of Motherhood" to US mums with six or more children.

question_sentence: The US has proposed a peace deal that would recognise Russian sovereignty over which Ukrainian region?
evidence: The US-backed plan would essentially freeze the current frontlines of the conflict, leaving Russia in control of Crimea, which it has held since invading the peninsula in 2014. Volodymyr Zelenskyy rejected the notion that Ukraine would give up territory seized by Russia, but Donald Trump was unsympathetic, suggesting Zelenskyy could either accept the deal or "fight for another three years before losing the whole country".

question_sentence: What percentage of the world's coral reefs have been impacted by a "mass bleaching" event?
evidence: The world is in the middle of its fourth known "mass bleaching event", according to the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration. Since 2023, heat stress has affected 83.7% of coral reefs around the word, well above the previous record of 68.2% set during the last global coral bleaching event between 2014 and 2017.

question_sentence: An emergency department in the US treats which kind of injury every 30 minutes?
evidence: Emergency medical service encounters for firearm injury spiked in 2021 and remain higher than before the Covid-19 pandemic.

question_sentence: Which artist received the most nominations for the 2025 American Music Awards?
evidence: Lamar leads the list with 10 nominations, including artist of the year, album of the year and song of the year.

question_sentence: Actor Ryan Gosling has long dreamed of appearing in which major movie franchise?
evidence: The “Barbie” actor, who had “Star Wars”-themed sheets on his childhood bed, will star in the new film “Star Wars: Starfighter.”

question_sentence: The US defeated which team to win the women’s ice hockey world championships?
evidence: The United States defeated Canada 4-3 thanks to Tessa Janecke’s goal in overtime.

question_sentence: Shocking video recently showed a woman and two children narrowly avoiding which near disaster?
choices: A car crashing into a storefront
Bricks falling from a construction site
evidence: Dramatic surveillance footage showed a manhole explosion in Poughkeepsie, New York.

question_sentence: About 3.6 million babies were born in the US last year. Which age group had the highest fertility rate?
evidence: The fertility rate was highest among women in their early 30s, while teen births and births among women in their early 20s declined to new lows.

question_sentence: Why is Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth under scrutiny again this week?
choices: Discovery of a second Signal group chat
Canceling the annual Army-Navy football game
Caught swearing on a hot mic
evidence: Hegseth shared detailed plans about a military operation against the Houthis in Yemen in a second Signal group chat that included his wife, his lawyer and his brother.

question_sentence: On which day did the EPA begin the process of firing and reassigning hundreds of staffers?
evidence: The changes, which happened on Earth Day, targeted staffers who worked on environmental justice and diversity issues.

question_sentence: Which movie topped the box office last weekend?
evidence: “Sinners,” the vampire film starring Michael B. Jordan, earned $45.6 million in its theatrical debut. (Both “Sinners” and “A Minecraft Movie” are distributed by Warner Bros. Pictures which, like CNN, is owned by Warner Bros. Discovery.)

question_sentence: Why did Los Angeles Dodgers star Shohei Ohtani miss last week’s game against the Texas Rangers?
choices: He came down with the flu
evidence: Ohtani’s wife Mamiko gave birth to their first child, a girl.
